page.title: 11Communications
page.content: Most homes have a telephone, a television and radio.Newspapers are available at the local shop. The{telephone}provides an obvious link with other people and services as well as being a means of gaining information such as weather, time etc. There are two public telephones in the area. The{television}provides the most popular entertainment and many homes have colour televisions. Teletext and Ceefax provide useful sources of information and T.V. news is watched by most people . Some elderly people have No T.V. but this is unusual .A TV license has to be purchased each year and at present there is a choice of 4 channels-all U.K. ones. Citizen band radios are popular and many vehicles have these installed.
